A Little About Me

I'm someone who loves to learn about technology. As a child, I was always very interested in how things worked, which often lead to the disassembling of whatever I was curious about. Be it the home computer, my clock, or the radio, you can almost guarantee that it's been in pieces at one point. This curiousity coupled with my interest in video games eventually lead me to one of my current hobbies, collecting and refurbishing old games and consoles.

While I'm currently a Web Developer, it would be my dream to eventually get into Software Engineering, or something similar in the Computer Science field, which can stimulate and hold my interest. Like most of the younger generation, I often find myself bored when I'm not being challenged. I would say this is more of a gift than a curse though, since it enables me to thrive in this day and age with the ever changing environment of technology.

Experience



Web Development Internship

November 2016 - June 2017

Portsmouth, Ohio


My time spent here was as a student worker for the Communications Department, where I mostly maintained the school's website, to be within the ADA Standards, as other departments and staff requested updates to their respective pages. There were, however, a few moments where I could apply custom JavaScript alongside HTML & CSS in order to spruse up the appearance of certain pages.



Service Technician

October 2016 - June 2017

Portsmouth, Ohio


During my time with the Wifi Solutions Group, I worked a few jobs. I started as an assitant to the Intern who worked on Shawnee State University's campus. While in this role, I mostly helped the Intern with whatever job needed to be completed that day. Most of these jobs were completing resident calls in Student Housing. When I became a Service Technician, this workflow continued with the addition of giving a helping hand to one of the Senior Partners in various locations around Ohio. These jobs were typically more advanced such as: setting up wireless access points on development sites, running CAT5 cabling through buildings, and replacing outdated or broken technology such as bridges and gateways.


L&D Web Developer

June 2017 - Present

Cincinnati, Ohio


While at Macy's, my time has been spent working on internal sites with help from our UX/UI Developer in order to provide the right solutions to our Business Units' needs. During this time, I've been constantly expanding my knowledge around the many tools and technologies which make Web Development easier and faster (e.g. Bootstrap, NodeJS, LESS/SASS, etc.).

Skills

While Crystal, Ruby, & JavaScript are the languages I am the most passionate about, I've had exposure to a wide array of languages. Be it compiled or interpreted, I've likely heard of the language.
